messages.message: Hey folks, do we know if the API output is the same as the `records` in the downstream integration? I don't think it is. cc: @jack.robbins

no, the output returned by `/api/v2/apps/runs/:run_id/results` is not the same as the format of `records` in downstream integration functions

compare https://docs.instabase.com/api-sdk/api-reference/runs/get-run-results vs https://docs.instabase.com/apps/run-and-deploy#integration-function
I think it would make sense to reconcile and align these. What is the engineering opinion here?
i agree! i think we've verbally discussed this, but if there isn't a ticket yet, we should create one!
I'm surprised by this too - what prompted the question?
I was trying to play around with this and was just confused lol
maybe step 1 is to call this `documents`, not`records` , inside `results` :lolcry:
we'd need to be careful about changing this if customers have already started to use this, but we can figure that out once we're ready to prioritize it
Lol i love Serena new fav emoji :lolcry:
